speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: SCENE I. Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Enter BERTRAM, the COUNTESS of Rousillon, HELENA, and LAFEU, all in black

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: In delivering my son from me, I bury a second husband.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: And I in going, madam, weep o'er my father's death

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: anew: but I must attend his majesty's command, to

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: whom I am now in ward, evermore in subjection.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: You shall find of the king a husband, madam; you,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: sir, a father: he that so generally is at all times

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: good must of necessity hold his virtue to you; whose

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: worthiness would stir it up where it wanted rather

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: than lack it where there is such abundance.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: What hope is there of his majesty's amendment?

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: He hath abandoned his physicians, madam; under whose

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: practises he hath persecuted time with hope, and

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: finds no other advantage in the process but only the

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: losing of hope by time.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: This young gentlewoman had a father,--O, that

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: 'had'! how sad a passage 'tis!--whose skill was

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: almost as great as his honesty; had it stretched so

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: far, would have made nature immortal, and death

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: should have play for lack of work. Would, for the

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: king's sake, he were living! I think it would be

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: the death of the king's disease.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: How called you the man you speak of, madam?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: He was famous, sir, in his profession, and it was

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: his great right to be so: Gerard de Narbon.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: He was excellent indeed, madam: the king very

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: lately spoke of him admiringly and mourningly: he

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: was skilful enough to have lived still, if knowledge

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: could be set up against mortality.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: What is it, my good lord, the king languishes of?

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: A fistula, my lord.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: I heard not of it before.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I would it were not notorious. Was this gentlewoman

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: the daughter of Gerard de Narbon?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: His sole child, my lord, and bequeathed to my

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: overlooking. I have those hopes of her good that

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: her education promises; her dispositions she

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: inherits, which makes fair gifts fairer; for where

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: an unclean mind carries virtuous qualities, there

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: commendations go with pity; they are virtues and

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: traitors too; in her they are the better for their

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: simpleness; she derives her honesty and achieves her goodness.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Your commendations, madam, get from her tears.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: 'Tis the best brine a maiden can season her praise

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: in. The remembrance of her father never approaches

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: her heart but the tyranny of her sorrows takes all

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: livelihood from her cheek. No more of this, Helena;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: go to, no more; lest it be rather thought you affect

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: a sorrow than have it.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I do affect a sorrow indeed, but I have it too.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Moderate lamentation is the right of the dead,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: excessive grief the enemy to the living.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: If the living be enemy to the grief, the excess

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: makes it soon mortal.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Madam, I desire your holy wishes.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: How understand we that?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Be thou blest, Bertram, and succeed thy father

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: In manners, as in shape! thy blood and virtue

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Contend for empire in thee, and thy goodness

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Share with thy birthright! Love all, trust a few,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Do wrong to none: be able for thine enemy

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Rather in power than use, and keep thy friend

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Under thy own life's key: be cheque'd for silence,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: But never tax'd for speech. What heaven more will,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: That thee may furnish and my prayers pluck down,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Fall on thy head! Farewell, my lord;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: 'Tis an unseason'd courtier; good my lord,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Advise him.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: He cannot want the best

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: That shall attend his love.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Heaven bless him! Farewell, Bertram.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: [To HELENA]  The best wishes that can be forged in

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: your thoughts be servants to you! Be comfortable

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: to my mother, your mistress, and make much of her.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Farewell, pretty lady: you must hold the credit of

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: your father.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Exeunt BERTRAM and LAFEU

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: O, were that all! I think not on my father;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And these great tears grace his remembrance more

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Than those I shed for him. What was he like?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I have forgot him: my imagination

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Carries no favour in't but Bertram's.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I am undone: there is no living, none,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: If Bertram be away. 'Twere all one

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That I should love a bright particular star

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And think to wed it, he is so above me:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: In his bright radiance and collateral light

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Must I be comforted, not in his sphere.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The ambition in my love thus plagues itself:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The hind that would be mated by the lion

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Must die for love. 'Twas pretty, though plague,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To see him every hour; to sit and draw

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: His arched brows, his hawking eye, his curls,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: In our heart's table; heart too capable

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Of every line and trick of his sweet favour:

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But now he's gone, and my idolatrous fancy

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Must sanctify his reliques. Who comes here?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Enter PAROLLES

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Aside

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: One that goes with him: I love him for his sake;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And yet I know him a notorious liar,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Think him a great way fool, solely a coward;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Yet these fixed evils sit so fit in him,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That they take place, when virtue's steely bones

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Look bleak i' the cold wind: withal, full oft we see

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Cold wisdom waiting on superfluous folly.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Save you, fair queen!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And you, monarch!

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: No.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And no.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Are you meditating on virginity?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Ay. You have some stain of soldier in you: let me

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: ask you a question. Man is enemy to virginity; how

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: may we barricado it against him?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Keep him out.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But he assails; and our virginity, though valiant,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: in the defence yet is weak: unfold to us some

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: warlike resistance.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: There is none: man, sitting down before you, will

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: undermine you and blow you up.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Bless our poor virginity from underminers and

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: blowers up! Is there no military policy, how

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: virgins might blow up men?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Virginity being blown down, man will quicklier be

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: blown up: marry, in blowing him down again, with

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: the breach yourselves made, you lose your city. It

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: is not politic in the commonwealth of nature to

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: preserve virginity. Loss of virginity is rational

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: increase and there was never virgin got till

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: virginity was first lost. That you were made of is

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: metal to make virgins. Virginity by being once lost

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: may be ten times found; by being ever kept, it is

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: ever lost: 'tis too cold a companion; away with 't!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I will stand for 't a little, though therefore I die a virgin.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: There's little can be said in 't; 'tis against the

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: rule of nature. To speak on the part of virginity,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: is to accuse your mothers; which is most infallible

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: disobedience. He that hangs himself is a virgin:

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: virginity murders itself and should be buried in

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: highways out of all sanctified limit, as a desperate

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: offendress against nature. Virginity breeds mites,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: much like a cheese; consumes itself to the very

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: paring, and so dies with feeding his own stomach.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Besides, virginity is peevish, proud, idle, made of

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: self-love, which is the most inhibited sin in the

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: canon. Keep it not; you cannot choose but loose

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: by't: out with 't! within ten year it will make

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: itself ten, which is a goodly increase; and the

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: principal itself not much the worse: away with 't!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: How might one do, sir, to lose it to her own liking?

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Let me see: marry, ill, to like him that ne'er it

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: likes. 'Tis a commodity will lose the gloss with

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: lying; the longer kept, the less worth: off with 't

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: while 'tis vendible; answer the time of request.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Virginity, like an old courtier, wears her cap out

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: of fashion: richly suited, but unsuitable: just

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: like the brooch and the tooth-pick, which wear not

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: now. Your date is better in your pie and your

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: porridge than in your cheek; and your virginity,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: your old virginity, is like one of our French

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: withered pears, it looks ill, it eats drily; marry,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: 'tis a withered pear; it was formerly better;

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: marry, yet 'tis a withered pear: will you anything with it?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Not my virginity yet [         ]

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: There shall your master have a thousand loves,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: A mother and a mistress and a friend,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: A phoenix, captain and an enemy,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: A guide, a goddess, and a sovereign,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: A counsellor, a traitress, and a dear;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: His humble ambition, proud humility,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: His jarring concord, and his discord dulcet,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: His faith, his sweet disaster; with a world

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Of pretty, fond, adoptious christendoms,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That blinking Cupid gossips. Now shall he--

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I know not what he shall. God send him well!

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The court's a learning place, and he is one--

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: What one, i' faith?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That I wish well. 'Tis pity--

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: What's pity?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That wishing well had not a body in't,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Which might be felt; that we, the poorer born,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Whose baser stars do shut us up in wishes,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Might with effects of them follow our friends,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: And show what we alone must think, which never

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Return us thanks.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Enter Page

speaker: Page
text_entry: Monsieur Parolles, my lord calls for you.

speaker: Page
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Little Helen, farewell; if I can remember thee, I

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: will think of thee at court.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Monsieur Parolles, you were born under a charitable star.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Under Mars, I.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: I especially think, under Mars.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Why under Mars?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The wars have so kept you under that you must needs

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: be born under Mars.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: When he was predominant.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: When he was retrograde, I think, rather.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Why think you so?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: You go so much backward when you fight.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: That's for advantage.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: So is running away, when fear proposes the safety;

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: but the composition that your valour and fear makes

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: in you is a virtue of a good wing, and I like the wear well.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: I am so full of businesses, I cannot answer thee

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: acutely. I will return perfect courtier; in the

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: which, my instruction shall serve to naturalize

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: thee, so thou wilt be capable of a courtier's

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: counsel and understand what advice shall thrust upon

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: thee; else thou diest in thine unthankfulness, and

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: thine ignorance makes thee away: farewell. When

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: thou hast leisure, say thy prayers; when thou hast

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: none, remember thy friends; get thee a good husband,

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: and use him as he uses thee; so, farewell.

speaker: PAROLLES
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Our remedies oft in ourselves do lie,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Which we ascribe to heaven: the fated sky

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Gives us free scope, only doth backward pull

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Our slow designs when we ourselves are dull.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What power is it which mounts my love so high,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That makes me see, and cannot feed mine eye?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The mightiest space in fortune nature brings

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: To join like likes and kiss like native things.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Impossible be strange attempts to those

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: That weigh their pains in sense and do suppose

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: What hath been cannot be: who ever strove

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: So show her merit, that did miss her love?

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: The king's disease--my project may deceive me,

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: But my intents are fix'd and will not leave me.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Exit
